author: phklive
content:
Hey, in the process of building a new implementation of a consensus client in Elixir.

We are for now using a NIF to use the Rust SSZ library. I would like to know if someone has experience in implementing SSZ, we are thinking about implementing SSZ in Elixir because we are having to many corner case errors with the Rust to Elixir NIF. 

What do you think and what is the work weight of such an impl ?

author: mariohavel
content: Just refresh the call if you got kicked out

author: joshd4078
content: As mentioned on the call today, we will be extending the office hours call tomorrow by 30 minutes in order to get through as many project proposals as possible. Looking forward to hearing all your presentations!

author: potuz
content: I have my own recent implementation of ssz <https://github.com/OffchainLabs/sszpp> it shouldn't take more than a couple of weeks. I advice you to hook to the same hashing library if linking to assembly is free on elixir (I know nothing about it)
